subject: Business
title: The Disposition Effect in Investing
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Disposition Effect in Investing usable.

hook.text: Investors sell winning stocks too early and hold losing stocks too long. Every study confirms it.

buildup.text: The disposition effect combines loss aversion and mental accounting into one costly investing mistake.

discovery.text: Selling winners feels good â€” you lock in a gain. Holding losers avoids the pain of admitting failure.

twist.text: The rational move is opposite: let winners run and cut losers fast. Emotions push us backward.

climax.text: Odean studied 10,000 brokerage accounts and found this pattern was nearly universal.

punchline.text: We sell our flowers and water our weeds.

quiz.question: What is the disposition effect?
options: Selling winners too early and holding losers too long
